solution_line_template: The volume of 1 iron bar is {bar_length} cm x {bar_width} cm x {bar_height} cm = <<{bar_length}*{bar_width}*{bar_height}={volume_one_bar}>>{volume_one_bar} cubic cm.
The volume of {num_iron_bars} iron bars is {num_iron_bars} x {volume_one_bar} cubic cm = <<{num_iron_bars}*{volume_one_bar}={total_volume_bars}>>{total_volume_bars} cubic cm.
Therefore, there are {total_volume_bars}/{volume_each_ball} = <<{total_volume_bars}/{volume_each_ball}={num_iron_balls_molded}>>{num_iron_balls_molded} iron balls that have been molded.
